snippet: Any new bailout deal between the country and its creditors is likely to include harsher austerity measures based on an increasingly grim economic outlook, analysts said.
abstract: Greece is effectively insolvent, and there seems to be little chance of resuming debt bailout negotiations with its creditors until after referendum vote on bailout offer; analysts say any new bailout deal between country and its creditors is likely to include harsher austerity measures as result of increasingly weakened economic outlook.

byline.original: By LIZ ALDERMAN and JACK EWING
byline.contributor: Liz Alderman reported from Athens, and Jack Ewing from Frankfurt.

lead_paragraph: Any new bailout deal between the country and its creditors is likely to include harsher austerity measures based on an increasingly grim economic outlook, analysts said.

headline.main: A Bankrupt Greece Is Struggling to Stay Afloat
headline.print_headline: Economy Gasping for Air In a Bankrupt Greece
